name: Harmony-Hotel Harfenwirt

reviews.text: The Harfenwirt is very well placed for skiing: a button (hooray!) drag lift opposite takes you via an easy piste direct to the gondola and ski school meeting place in the centre of the village. Another button draglift on the nursery slopes in the village centre enables you to ski back to the hotel across a footpath (icy) or the adjoining fields. Ski race events take place in the evening at the base of the red run opposite, which also provides good sledging. The ski school prizegiving took place in the hotel on the friday evening, which was great fun. Make sure you wait for the instructors' cow bell ringing! The large new extension incorporates accomodation, a dining room and a swimming pool. All are of very good quality, and our room in the extension was spotless, the bathroom had wonderful heated floor and towel rails, and the generously proportioned balcony had probably the best view in Niederau! The breakfast buffet was good, with enough choice to please most people. Generally, the hotel is fairly cosy and friendly, and smokers are tightly restricted to the small bar area. However, there are some negatives. The evening meals were okay, but are basic, suffer from regularly featuring frozen veg, and the small number of waiters are run off their feet. Inevitably this leads to some long delays for main courses. Although the ski room has good fittings, it is very small and cramped, and has a grand total of one seat. A better option may be the larger (but less secure) ski room under the Irish pub by the gondola station. There are no towels provided in the swimming pool, so either bring your own or use your room's. Lastly, the legendary Herbert caused us to queue for an hour to check in. Various families in front of us were having lengthy and angst filled conversations with him due to being farmed out to various chalets. However, when we reached him, it took no more than 5 minutes to be processed, and were very happy with our allocated room. The families encountering the hassle had all appeared to have booked with Inghams, whereas we booked with Crystal (and had paid a supplement for a balcony) . Despite these relatively minor irritations, we enjoyed the hotel and the holiday. If you get a great last minute deal here then it is a good value place to stay. Just don't expect top notch food and service.
reviews.title: Enjoyable holiday but hotel is a little disappointing

reviews.text: Hotel - OK
reviews.title: Skis stolen

likes.liked: — It was new and rooms were very spacious with a nice balcony

reviews.text: Check in - Slow
reviews.title: Do Not Expect A Lot

reviews.text: Food - OK
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

likes.liked: — Large, new rooms - think we were the first guest to ever stay in ours!

reviews.text: Room - Good
reviews.title: Lovely new rooms

likes.liked: — the new rooms and leisure suite

reviews.text: I stayed at the Harfenwirt with family on an Inghams package holiday (full board). The hotel room was clean and spacious however the staff lacked charm and weren't very friendly. Breakfast buffet was the same every day and we had to fight for it with the tour buses which were shuttled there from another hotel every day. Dinner was as poor and uneventful as the breakfast. We ended up eating out a few nights and had brilliant Austrian food. I had high hopes for the Harfenwirt with Herbert's reputation that we read about before we left but it was disappointing and I won't go back.
reviews.title: Clean but lacked charm
great walking holiday
reviews.text: spent 2-weeks beginning sept. 2008, booked through Inghams(internet). half-board with packed lunch each day. initially given room overlooking extension building work, but after a word with the owner, Herbert soon moved to lovely room.

after reading some reviews were a bit apprehensive about the food, accommodation and Herbert. however, Herbert was very approachable, made a point of speaking to every guest each day and very helpful and friendly. We found the food to be very good, with reasonable sized portions (salad excellent). there were only two choices of main course, but always something that we liked. Delicious home-made soups. Breakfast was continental style - always with cheese and cold meats, cereal, juice, lovely rolls, tea and coffee. the packed lunches each day delicious at the top of the mountains.
reviews.title: Extension madness

likes.disliked: — General apathy towards guests, and uncompromising attitude regarding building work.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located on the edge of the village, with bus stops just outside. just a few minutes walk to the village centre and cable-car station..The weekly bus ticket is excellent value, as is the cable-car 6-day ticket. very cheap to get around. So many walks. The information office,however, is not well-placed, being a 20-minute walk - betweeen Neiderau and Oberau. - fine if you have a car, or a bus ticket.
reviews.title: excellent value for money

reviews.text: Neiderau is a typical Austrian village - ideal if you want away from the touristy shops. Ideal centre for a walking holiday. not for those wanting shops and night-life.
reviews.title: hotel harfenwirt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned from a week's skiing in Niederau where we stayed at the Harfenwirt (despite some of the reviews on this website).
reviews.title: Loved Niederau

likes.liked: — The room, swimming pool and the terrific view
likes.disliked: — The bar had very little atmosphere and the owner is a bit dour

reviews.text: First the great things. We had a wonderful room in the brand new extension. We paid a little extra for it and it was worth every penny. Every morning it was a joy to wake up to a stupendous view down the valley and towards the mountains. The room had a balcony which would be wonderful to sit on in the summer just to soak in that view. The bathroom had a bath and shower, with heated towel rad and underfloor heating, so we were lovely and warm - too warm in the bedroom at times, we had to turn down the heating! The bed was very comfortable and we slept well.
reviews.title: Really great family experience!

reviews.text: In the new extension is a lovely swimming pool with sauna, steam room and infra red room, and we used the pool every day.
reviews.title: the harfenwrt

likes.disliked: — no kettle facilites in the rooms, cup of coffee in the room woulid be nice,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just across the road is one of the nursery slopes, which was great for us as we were complete beginners. We went with Inghams and couldn't fault the rep, who was extremely helpful. We had booked a whole week of lessons with the Red Ski School, and the instructors were wonderful - my husband ended up in Jason's more advanced group, but I was happy with Andreas, who specialises in teaching people who want to learn at a slower pace.
reviews.title: Great hotel on a budget...

reviews.text: Slight niggles:
reviews.title: Quirky hotel

likes.disliked: — Poor reception, bar staffing and lack of time in well being centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a week (31 Jan - 6 Feb 09) at the Hotel Harfenwirt in Neiderau, Austria booked through lastminute. com.
reviews.title: Good Hotel for the Price

reviews.text: The Hotel is approx 2 - 2.5hrs transfer from Saltzberg via coach. Neiderau is the largest of the towns in the area and the Hotel Harfenwirt is well located for nursary/intermediate slopes and only a short walk to the Gondola and town centre.
reviews.title: A great family holiday

likes.liked: — made our ski holiday really easy
likes.disliked: — having to walk up to the first floor with heavy suitcases at four in the morning on the final day

reviews.text: The Hotel comprises the main Hotel and recent extension and a typical Austrian style Chalet called the Guesthouse, approx 2 mins walk from the Harfenwirt Hotel.
reviews.title: unique experience

reviews.text: We stayed in the Guesthouse and whilst, on first impression it didnt look as good as the main hotel we felt it suited us better in the end. We had a large bedroom with small table & 2 chairs, double bed (twin matresses & duvets) and a single pull-out chair bed; double wardrobes and shelves, plus bathroom with shower.
reviews.title: Great holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The advantage for us over the main Hotel was that we had a small kitchenette area which had 2 electric hobs, fridge and sink plus cutlery and crockery. Our room also had a large balcony which overlooked the slopes. The kitchenette has to have power connected and this will cost 2 Euros per day which we felt was worth it. There is an adjoining building to the Guesthouse which houses goats and a small farm building opposite which kept Cows, but neither of those things bothered us.
reviews.title: Great value for money. Lovely hotel.

description: Tradition mixed with modern. Superb family hotel direct on the piste. Breathtaking views from all rooms. New large heated indoor pool (80m²) with sauna and steam bath overlooking the cross country tracks. Large sun terrace facing the Tennladen slopes Ski Arena race track and paragliders landing area.
